entry.title: Call Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application using oAuth2 authentication
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Does anyone have a resource/blog which will guide for accessing a Successfactors API from a SAP CAP application by using oAuth2 authentication method. Previously the approach was to use Username and Password, but that is being deprecated.

So to move towards the oAuth2 related authentication, i would like to know the steps that needs to be taken from SF admin center and also the steps needs to implemented in a CAP application to access this API based on this oAuth2 credentials. Kindly help. Thanks.

@qmacro : Kindly extend your help. Thanks.

entry.title: To set up a destination in SAP BTP for connecting to the Microsoft Azure Mail Service -Graph API
entry.content:
1. Access SAP BTP Cockpit 

  • Log into SAP BTP Cockpit: Go to SAP BTP Cockpit 
  • Navigate to Subaccount: In the subaccount of your choice (where the destination will be configured), click on the subaccount to access its settings.

2. Create a New Destination

  • Navigate to Destinations:

    • In the SAP BTP Cockpit, go to Connectivity > Destinations (under the Connectivity section in your subaccount).

    • Create New Destination:

      • Click + (Create New Destination).

      • Fill in the following fields:

3. Configure the Destination for Microsoft Graph API

     Fill in the required fields to define the destination for Microsoft Graph API:

     General Information

  • Name: Choose a descriptive name for the destination, e.g., AzureMailService.

  • Type: Select HTTP.

  • Description: Provide a brief description, e.g., "Destination for Microsoft Graph API to send transactional emails."

  • URL:  https://graph.microsoft.com/V1.0

4. Authentication Settings

  • Authentication:

    • Select OAuth2 for OAuth authentication, since Microsoft Graph API requires OAuth2 Client Credentials flow.

    • OAuth2 Client Credentials: This will be your method for obtaining access tokens to authenticate API requests.

      • OAuth2 Client ID: This is the Client ID from the Azure AD app you registered in the Azure portal.

      • OAuth2 Client Secret: This is the Client Secret generated for the Azure AD app.

      • OAuth2 Token URL: The token URL from Microsoft Identity Platform, which is:

         
        https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenantId}/oauth2/v2.0/token

        Replace {tenantId} with your actual tenant ID.

      • OAuth2 Scope: For sending emails, use the scope Mail.Send. This allows the app to send emails through Microsoft Graph API.

      • OAuth2 Grant Type: Choose Client Credentials as you're using the client credentials flow.

5.Connection Settings

  • URL: Set the URL to connect to Microsoft Graph API. The base URL for Microsoft Graph is:

     
    https://graph.microsoft.com

  • Proxy Type: If you are using a proxy, you can set it here. If not, leave it as None.

  • Additional Headers: You can add any extra headers if needed. Usually, for Microsoft Graph API, no additional headers are required apart from the authorization header, which is handled automatically by the OAuth2 configuration.

6. Test the Destination

  • Test Connectivity: After creating the destination, test it by clicking on Check Connection.

  • Successful Connection: If the connection is successful, you’ll see a message confirming that the destination is reachable.

7. Secure the Destination

  • Security Considerations:

    • Make sure that only authorized users and applications have access to this destination.

    • You can use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to limit who can access this destination in SAP BTP.

8. Integrate the Destination into Your Application

Once the destination is configured, you can integrate it into your Node.js or CAPM application to use it for sending emails.

  • Access Destination Programmatically:

    const { retrieveJwt } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/connectivity');
    const { executeHttpRequest } = require('@sap-cloud-sdk/http-client');
    module.exports = srv => {
      srv.on('sendmail', async (req) => {
            const JWT_Token = retrieveJwt(req);    // Access the destination via JWT Secured token
        const destination = {
          destinationName: 'AzureMailService', JWT_Token
         };
      }
    }

Use Destination in API Requests: Use the executeHttpRequest method from the SAP Cloud SDK to make requests to the Microsoft Graph API, passing in the destination to authenticate the request.

Conclusion

By setting up a destination for the Microsoft Azure Mail Service in SAP BTP, you establish a secure and centralized way for your SAP applications to send transactional emails via the Microsoft Graph API. This eliminates the need for third-party email services, reduces costs, and ensures a reliable and scalable email service across your BTP landscape.

entry.title: HDI deployment error : deployed file already provides it, Could not compose a consistent make graph
entry.content:
getting this error while subscribing a new tenant to our application.

the deployed file already provides it Could not compose a consistent make graph Calculating dependencies... failed Making... failed Starting make in the container "6D29AE79357049B781C527A584B55E75" with 13 files to deploy, 0 files to undeploy... failed'' at module.exports [as _UPDATE] (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/libx/_runtime/db/generic/update.js:95:9) at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5) at async next (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:69:17) at async HanaDatabase.handle (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds/lib/srv/srv-dispatch.js:67:10) at async retry (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/lib/utils.js:46:14) at async pickJob (/home/vcap/app/node_modules/@sap/cds-mtxs/srv/jobs-service.js:171:5)

Could you help me understand what could be the reasons getting this error ? sometimes the error doesnt show up while subscribing, but shows up while upgrading the tenant.

not sure which files to share, repo here https://github.tools.sap/one-sm/supplier-syndication

entry.title: How to trigger navigation to a specific URL from a CAP action in Fiori Elements
entry.content:
I’m using SAP CAP (Node.js, OData V4) together with a Fiori Elements V4 ListReport/ObjectPage app. I have a bound action on an entity that’s triggered by a button labeled “Open Target”. When the user triggers this action, I want the app to navigate to a known Object Page route using an already prepared hash URL. I’d like to avoid adding client-side controller extensions or custom UI logic if possible. I tried sending a notification with a target URL from the CAP action, but the app does not navigate. Current behavior: The toast shows but there is no navigation, no errors. In the future, I would like to read the ID when a line is selected, the button is clicked, read the ID of the line, and then use this ID for navigation. But for now I wanted to test that with a fixed ID.
This is because it goes to a different service endpoint. my-service.js is located in /srv, where the CD files are stored.

// srv/my-service.js
module.exports = cds.service.impl(function () {
    let url = `/myapp/webapp/index.html#/TargetEntity(ID=38cf6b1a-2356-404e-b423-f4e21a6b7611,IsActiveEntity=true)`;

    req.notify({
      type: 'Success',
      message: 'Opening target…',
      target: url
    });

    return 'OK';
  });
});

entry.title: SAP CDS/ CAP API Reference & Documentation
entry.content:
Hello,

Is there a detailed documentation of interfaces provided by  "sap/cds" package?
Me and my teammates are struggling to find detailed API Reference for CAP for quite a long time already.
The only resource available is https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/, but it does not provide enough information on CAP class methods, method return types etc. Without such documentation developer has to either go into source code of the npm package, or spend A lot of time debugging and testing ootb interfaces to understand what they can & can not do.
If anybody knows a page with detailed reference of each API provided by CAP - kindly share it, it will be much appreciated.

Here's an example of such documentation - API reference for MongoDB Node.js driver.
https://mongodb.github.io/node-mongodb-native/Next/modules.html

 

Regards,
Alex

entry.title: Python support in CAP based Application
entry.content: I know there is no support for python programming language in CAP. But due to recent advancements in AI, is there any plan to support python programming language in CAP considering most AI experts prefer working with python? If yes, is there any timeline that we can follow?

entry.title: Unable to deploy a CAP app
entry.content:
I created an app based on a local CAP project. I tried to deploy the app to BTP build workzone, but I am getting an error when I execute the command cds add workzone. This was working last month and I was able to deploy the app properly last time with the same steps. 

Error message: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'inbounds')

I have attached the screenshot of the error. I tried downgrading and updating the cds dk version and I still got the same issue.

Thanks,

Siva

entry.content: I’m currently working on a CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model) application and would like to understand the best practices for managing and maintaining multiple environments  as Development, Quality Assurance (QA), and Production.

entry.title: CAP application handling of innererror returned from SAP OData
entry.content:
Hello,

Sorry we are writing with such simple case but we can't find a good solution for it.

What we did is we created OData v2 in SAP backend. We created CAP (node.js) application which consume this OData and expose it as OData v4 (with small changes in entity fields).

In CAP application we are forwarding requests to backend using this command:

srv.on(["READ"], "EquipmentTimeSegment", async (request) => {
return services.equipment_srv.tx(request).run(request.query);
});

We deployed application with "production" profile to CloudFoundry.

While using application we noticed that when there is error returned from SAP with innererror details it is not returned by CAP application. We only get status 502 - exception during request. No details at all what happend.

 

Is there any standard CAP handler for it? Any settings we need to do to receive full error response from SAP on "production" profile?

Can someone advice something?

entry.title: BTP CAP – OData V4 metadata auto-updates with new fields, but V2 does not?
entry.content:
Odata v4:-

Odata v2:-


In my CAPM project on BTP, I see that when I add new fields, the OData V4 service metadata updates automatically. But in OData V2, the metadata stays unchanged unless regenerated. Why does this difference occur and how should I handle it?

entry.title: Is it possible make a CAP Application consume events from EMIS (Integration Suite Event Mesh) ?
entry.content:
Hi CAP community.

I am trying to leverage EMIS (Integration Suite's Event Mesh capability) within a CAP v9 Application. I am following this great video of @ajmaradiaga along side with CAP's documentation (which is not specific to EMIS, but to Standalone Event Mesh service). 

I have successfully set up a queue + topic subscription in EMIS which is receiving events from S/4HANA Public Cloud. I created a service instance of SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh (message-client plan) to provide the credentials to the CAP application (and S4), and bound it both in .cdsrc and mta to feed them at runtime. This is working.

So far so good,  but here is the twist: the bound credentials of the EMIS service don't contain the 'management' object that CAP's messaging service implementation is expecting. See the below error, which is what I am hitting after starting the cap server using

"kind": enterprise-messaging  (or -shared)

options.credentials is correctly bound to EMIS client service key, but no management object exist

I know that when you create an instance of the Standalone SAP Event Mesh service, the keys contain this management object, as stated in the 'documentation'. However, the binding to the EMIS Message Client doesn't:

This makes me wonder: is CAP prepared to integrate with Integration Suite's Event Mesh, or not yet? (CAP documentation doesn't mention this specific use case).

Is there something wrong within my set up?

 

Any help or clue is well appreciated!

Lucho

entry.title: Headers missing from CAP request in handler
entry.content:
Hi All!

I'm working on a CAP service that serves content to both an HTML5 app and an MDK app. I've created a handler to pre-filter some data according to the user ID. If the user is logged in using the MDK app, I want to detect this using the header' x-forwarded-path', which should be included in the request (I implemented this in another project successfully).

But this time, using CAP 8.9.2, I see only the x-correlation-id header in any request; a lot is missing. I saw some posts about missing authorisation headers, but not all the other headers (x-*** for example). 

My packages:

    "@sap/cds": "^8.9.2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^8.9.1",
    "@sap/xsenv": "^5.5.0",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4.6.0",

Has anyone here been through this before?

Thanks!

entry.title: Privilege Error When Calling Business Rules API from CAP Service via Job Scheduler
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I am encountering a privilege-related error when attempting to integrate and call Business Rules from a CAP (Cloud Application Programming) service, which is itself triggered by the Job Scheduling service in SAP BTP. The setup involves multiple destinations using OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials grant type for authentication. Below is a step-by-step breakdown of the architecture, configuration, and the exact error observed. I have verified the configurations multiple times, but the issue persists,

Overall Architecture and Flow:

  • Job Scheduling Service: This service is configured to periodically trigger a CAP service endpoint. The call from Job Scheduler to CAP is made via a Destination in SAP BTP.
    • Destination Type: OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials.
    • Purpose: To securely invoke the CAP service without user interaction.
  • CAP Service: A custom Node.js-based CAP application deployed in SAP BTP Cloud Foundry. Within the CAP service logic (specifically in a handler or action), we make an outbound call to the Business Rules API provided by SAP Build Process Automation.
    • The Business Rules are created and deployed in a specific test environment within SAP Build Process Automation.
    • The CAP service uses another Destination to call the Business Rules Runtime API.
      • Destination Type: OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials.
      • Credentials: Client ID and Client Secret are sourced directly from the Service Key of the SAP Build Process Automation service instance in our BTP subaccount.
  • Business Rules in SAP Build Process Automation:
    • Rules are defined in a test environment (e.g., "Test_ENV").
    • API Endpoint: We are calling the standard Business Rules Runtime API (e.g., bpa_host_name/public/rule/runtime/rest/v2/rule-services?environmentId=test).
  • The entire flow is designed for backend-to-backend communication, hence using Client Credentials for both destinations to avoid user-based authentication.

Sample Code to call 

      const destination: any = await getDestination(params);
      // Check if authTokens exist (populated by SAP Cloud SDK)
      if (!destination.authTokens || destination.authTokens.length === 0) {
        throw new Error("No auth token found in destination");
      }
      let response: HttpResponse;
      if (destination) {
        const bodyData = {
          RuleServiceId: ruleServiceId,
          Vocabulary: [context],
        };
        const url = WORKFLOW.URL.RULESERVICE + "?environmentId=" + env;
        response = await executeHttpRequest(destination, {
          method: HTTPMETHOD.POST,
          url: url,
          data: bodyData,
          headers: {
            "x-api-key": API_KEY, // or your key value directly
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
          },
        });

My xs-security.json 

 

Kindly let me know what config I shall do to get it working

Thanks for your support

Best Regards,

Sandeep

entry.title: Fiori Element ListReport initialLoad cannot be Disabled if liveMode is true
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to use the following setting so that I don't get an initial error on the UI, but it's not working.
I would like to get some help with this.
Fiori Elements, I tried with the most recent UI5 versions 1.138.0 and 1.139.0.

There is a mandatory filter field, and I would like the filter to work in live mode, but without initial load.
The expected behavior would be that filtering takes place after every filter setting without pressing the Go button (liveMode true), but there should be no initial filtering when the page loads (intialLoad Disabled), thus avoiding any error messages.

          "name": "sap.fe.templates.ListReport",
          "options": {
            "settings": {
              "initialLoad": "Disabled",
              "liveMode": true,

When I apply this setting in the manifest, the UI always loads with an initial error.

I would like to avoid this initial error.

I have created a GitHub repository with the example here.

Regards,
Peter

entry.title: Could not fetch JWT bearer token for service of type destination. Unable to map issuer: Origin claim
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have two CAP applications, where I'm doing the backend services. The apps are in the same subaccount, and it have individual xsuaa services.

The application "A" exposed a service url to be consumed by UI5 application with a destination type OAuth2UserTokenExchange and it's working fine.

The application "B" exposed other service using other destination with the same type OAuth2UserTokenExchange. In this service, I need consume the service from "A". To do this, I imported it as external service and I configured the destination in the package.json file.

When I consume it, using cds objects ( const remoteService = await cds.connect.to('API...'), I get this error:

ERR message: 'Error during request to remote service: Failed to load destination. Caused by: Could not fetch JWT bearer token for service of type destination: HTTP response from https://xxx/oauth/token was 401: {"error":"unauthorized","error_description":"Unable to map issuer: Origin claim is missing in the token."}.'

If I use a destination type OAuth2ClientCredentials works correctly.

Is it possible to propagate the user token using the CDS object, or do I need to make a REST call that includes the token?"

Thanks and regards.

entry.title: CAP (Node.js) OData V2 Batch Request using SAP Cloud SDK – How to capture all errors in a changeset?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working on a use case where I need to send a batch of update/create/delete requests from a SAP CAP (Node.js) backend to an SAP S/4HANA system. I'm using the SAP Cloud SDK and the Business Accelerator Hub to build and send the OData V2 (using odata-v2-adapter) batch requests.

Here’s what I’ve achieved so far:

  • I’m able to send multiple requests (update/create/delete) within a single batch.
  • To ensure transactional behavior, I wrap all these requests into one changeset.
  • This works well from a transactional standpoint: if any request fails, nothing is committed in S/4.

However, here’s the problem, when one request inside the changeset fails, only a single error is returned, and the rest of the requests are not processed. This behavior is expected according to OData V2 specs and SAP Cloud SDK documentation:

  • “The body of a ChangeSet response is either a response for all the successfully processed change request within the ChangeSet [...] or a single response indicating a failure of the entire ChangeSet.” (OData V2)
  • “If the execution of any request within a changeset fails, the whole changeset will be reflected as an error in the response.” (SAP Cloud SDK)

What I tried:

  • Splitting requests into multiple changesets (one per request) within the same batch allows me to retrieve individual errors, but I lose transactional integrity, some changes are committed while others fail.
  • I also explored the continueOnError option from the odata-v2-adapter, but it only applies between multiple changesets, not within a single changeset. So, again, it doesn’t help with my use case. (SAP Community Q&A)

What I’m looking for:

  • Is there any way (official or workaround) to get detailed errors for all requests without sacrificing atomicity?
  • Alternatively, is there a way to simulate or validate a batch in a “check” or “test” mode, without actually executing it in the S/4HANA backend, just to detect all potential errors?
  • Or is the recommended approach, as suggested by CAP documentation, to implement strong input validation before triggering the batch, to ensure that it will succeed?

Any insights, ideas, or shared experiences would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Migration of an HTML application from neo to cloud foundry environment
entry.content:
Hi All, 
I have a problem to solve. Recently, I migrated an HTML5 application from BTP neo to cloud foundry with the process guided on sap help portal. the application got migrated successfully and also, I migrated my destination from my BTP neo to cloud foundry environment in order to connect my application to backend. But when I preview my application, it shows the error in my ui5.yaml file.

Attached pictures are the screenshots of my ui5.yaml file.

Here's the detailed log of the error in my terminal when I'm using command "npm run start":

backend: [{"path":"/sap","url":"http://pvlhe4decc1.lthe.com:8101","client":"110","destination":"S4HANA_DEV"},{"path":"/api/UploadDocumentToSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""},{"path":"/api/DownloadDocumentFromSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""}]

Failed to register backend for /api/UploadDocumentToSP. Check configuration in yaml file.

Can someone help me with this error?





Regards,

Abhishek

entry.title: Troubleshoot CAP plugin for Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm currently trying out the CAP plugin for advanced event mesh.

I followed this documentation and tried to tune the bookshop sample to connect to AEM by adding this section in the package.json:

   "requires": {
      "messaging": {
        "kind": "advanced-event-mesh",
        "skipManagement": false,
        "credentials": {
          "user-provided": {
            "name": "advanced-event-mesh"
          }
        },
        "queue": {
          "queueName": "testQ",
          "permission": "EXLUSIVE",
          "ingressEnabled": true,
          "egressEnabled": true
        }
      }
    }

I was first encountering this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.


❗️ ERROR on server start: ❗️

 Error: Missing or malformed credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.

Bind your app to a user-provided service with name "advanced-event-mesh" and credentials in the following format:
{
  "authentication-service": {
    "tokenendpoint": "https://<ias host>/oauth2/token",
    "clientid": "<client id>",
    "clientsecret": "<client secret>"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "advanced-event-mesh": {
      "uri": "https://<broker host>:<port>",
      "smf_uri": "wss://<broker host>:<port>"
    }
  },
  "vpn": "<vpn>"
}
    at _validateAndFetchEndpoints (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:37:91)

So I wired my AEM credentials via user-provided service.
Then followed this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

Error: Missing credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh with plan "aem-validation-service".

You need to create a service binding.
    at _validateBroker (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:99:11)

So next I created an instance of the aem-validation-service  (in the same subaccount, as learned from this question) and bound it to CAP using cds bind. 

Finally, the cds watch (or cds serve command) starts up with no more errors. But now, somehow it is stuck after this step:

resolving cloud service bindings...
bound messaging to cf user provided service advanced-event-mesh
bound custom-service:cap2aem to cf managed service cap2aem:cap2aem-key
[cds] - loaded model from 7 file(s):

  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/srv/outbox.cds
  srv/user-service.cds
  srv/cat-service.cds
  srv/access-control.cds
  srv/admin-service.cds
  db/schema.cds
  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/common.cds

[cds] - connect to db > sqlite { url: ':memory:' }
  > init from db/init.js 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Genres.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.texts.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Authors.csv 
/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

The app is not served at localhost:4004, nothing is happening after the log output "successfully deployed to in-memory database".
As I'm not super experienced with CAP, I don't know if I missed something crucial or how the issue could be examined further.

I'm very thankful for every hint or help provided.

entry.title: SAP CAP action with Unstructured/Dynamic Type Input
entry.content:
Following the blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-cap-function-and-action-with-unstructured-dynamic-type-input-output/ba-p/13571201 by @Ajit_K_Panda I was able to create a CAP service with dynamic Output structure, but not a dynamic Input structure.

The service defined in the blog, still requires the input structure, to have the data object name as input, as mentioned in the sample payload:

action   MyAction(input : object)       returns object;
{
    "input":{
        "field1":123,
        "field2":"Value"
    }
}

As soon as I add a new name in the json object, the input validation fails saying: Property "...." does not exist in....

 

{
    "input":{
        "field1":123,
        "field2":"Value"
    },
    "newfield":"newvalue"
}

Is there any option to:

  1. Ignore the names that cannot be mapped, to avoid Property mapping error, OR
  2. Define a completely dynamic input object, similar to how the output is defined (e.g action MyAction(object) returns object;)
